ADX.name: ADX
ADX.description: Aggregate Data Exchange standard for exchanging aggregate health data, commonly used in public health reporting and statistical analysis.

CIEL.name: CIEL
CIEL.description: Columbia International eHealth Laboratory dictionary, a comprehensive clinical terminology system designed for use in low-resource settings.

GS1.name: GS1
GS1.description: Global Standards One, an international standard for supply chain management and product identification in healthcare.

HL7 FHIR.name: HL7 FHIR
HL7 FHIR.description: Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources, a modern standard for exchanging healthcare information electronically.

FHIR.name: FHIR
FHIR.description: Alias for HL7 FHIR - Fast Healthcare Interoperability Resources, a modern standard for exchanging healthcare information electronically.

HL7 V2.name: HL7 V2
HL7 V2.description: Health Level 7 Version 2, a messaging standard for exchanging clinical and administrative data in healthcare settings.

HL7 V3.name: HL7 V3
HL7 V3.description: Health Level 7 Version 3, an XML-based messaging framework for health data exchange and interoperability.

ICD-9.name: ICD-9
ICD-9.description: International Classification of Diseases, 9th Revision, for coding and classifying mortality and morbidity data.

ICD-10.name: ICD-10
ICD-10.description: International Classification of Diseases, 10th Revision, WHO's standard diagnostic classification for epidemiology and health management.

ICD.name: ICD
ICD.description: Alias for ICD-10 - International Classification of Diseases, WHO's standard diagnostic classification.

ICD-11.name: ICD-11
ICD-11.description: International Classification of Diseases, 11th Revision, the latest WHO classification for mortality, morbidity statistics and clinical documentation.

LOINC.name: LOINC
LOINC.description: Logical Observation Identifiers Names and Codes, a universal standard for identifying medical laboratory observations.

SNOMED.name: SNOMED
SNOMED.description: Systematized Nomenclature of Medicine Clinical Terms, a comprehensive clinical terminology for electronic health records.

DICOM.name: DICOM
DICOM.description: Digital Imaging and Communications in Medicine, the international standard for medical images and related information.

ODK.name: Open Data Kit
ODK.description: Open source mobile data collection platform for building forms and collecting data in the field.

OpenHIE.name: Open Health Information Exchange
OpenHIE.description: Open architecture framework for health information exchange in resource-constrained settings.

CAP.name: Common Alerting Protocol
CAP.description: Standard format for emergency alerts and public warnings across different communication systems.

EDXL.name: Emergency Data Exchange Language
EDXL.description: Standard for sharing emergency management information between organizations and systems.

REST.name: REST
REST.description: Representational State Transfer, an architectural style for designing networked applications and web services.

HTTP.name: HTTP
HTTP.description: Hypertext Transfer Protocol, the foundation protocol for data communication on the World Wide Web.

HTTPS.name: HTTPS
HTTPS.description: HTTP Secure, an extension of HTTP that uses encryption for secure communication over networks.

Not Applicable Health.name: Not Applicable
Not Applicable Health.description: Indicates that no specific health standard is applicable to the given context.

Other Health.name: Other
Other Health.description: Refers to health standards not listed in the current classification system.

GRIB.name: GRIB
GRIB.description: GRIdded Binary format, a standard for encoding meteorological and oceanographic data.

NetCDF.name: NetCDF
NetCDF.description: Network Common Data Form, a set of software libraries and machine-independent data formats for array-oriented scientific data.

GML.name: GML
GML.description: Geography Markup Language, an XML grammar for expressing geographical features.

WFS.name: WFS
WFS.description: Web Feature Service, provides an interface allowing requests for geographical features across the web.

WCS.name: WCS
WCS.description: Web Coverage Service, provides access to coverage data in forms useful for client-side rendering.

WMS.name: WMS
WMS.description: Web Map Service, provides map images from a geographic information system database.

HDF.name: HDF
HDF.description: Hierarchical Data Format, a set of file formats designed to store and organize large amounts of numerical data.

BUFR.name: BUFR
BUFR.description: Binary Universal Form for the Representation of meteorological data, a binary data format for meteorological observations.

Not Applicable Weather.name: Not Applicable
Not Applicable Weather.description: Indicates that no specific weather or climate standard is applicable to the given context.

Other Weather.name: Other
Other Weather.description: Refers to weather and climate standards not listed in the current classification system.
